title: John Herschel
summary: Sir John Frederick William Herschel, 1st Baronet KH FRS (/ˈhɜːrʃəl, ˈhɛər-/;[2] 7 March 1792 – 11 May 1871)[1] was an English polymath active as a mathematician, astronomer, chemist, inventor, experimental photographer who invented the blueprint,[3][4][5] and did botanical work.[6]
